docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
The Dars Recorder is an Application that integrates with OBS https://obsproject.com

The goal is to setup a Schedule for the Lessons done by the Imam or other members of the community. At the Masjid Khaled Ben Walid we have lessons after Fajr prayer, Dhuhur Prayer and Isha prayer for about 20-30 minutes.

What this automation does is it starts recording at specified schedules based on the Iqama API that we use, so:

  • Starts Recording at one of the Prayers above
  • Stops Recording 1 hour later

The scheduling can be setup for the day of the week for special cases like the Jumuaa prayer which only occurs on Fridays and records for 2 hours instead (for the 2 Khutbahs)

docs.title: Download Release
docs.text:
To setup the Dars Recorder (the cli is called darsrec), go to the release page and install the latest based on your operating system: https://github.com/ccil-kbw/robot/releases

Unpackage and move the file to an appropriate location (e.g /usr/local/bin/darsrec)

docs.title: OBS WebSockets
docs.text: Enable WebSockets on the OBS application and note down the password to log in there.

docs.title: Run darsrec
docs.text:
• Open a Terminal and export OBS_WEBSOCKET_PASSWORD=YOUR_WEBSOCKET_SECRET
  • Run darsrec

NOTE: We strongly recommend keeping the software in the same network as your OBS application, either a server aside or on the same machine. NOTE2: You can either use nohup or create a service similar to the one in the Discord Bot documentation

docs.title: Roadmap
docs.text:
At the moment we are in the Alpha and stabilization phase, everything is currently hardcoded in the software itself, so:

  • Use a configuration file to setup the Schedule (Delta of Iqamas or Specific week days/times)
  • Add an API for admins to see what's going on (READONLY), this is simply for visibility

docs.title: Setup
docs.text:
First to Setup a Bot in your Server please follow the official documentation here: https://discord.com/developers/docs/getting-started#step-1-creating-an-app

From there you will be able to get your Server's ID, we will name it GUILD_ID in the Installation phase. You'll also need your Bot's Token that we're calling BOT_TOKEN

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: Bismillah

docs.title: Download Release
docs.text:
To download our Discord Bot, go to our releases page and download the latest iqamabot with the distribution of choice.

We currently build for MacOs (darwin) and Linux, if interested in other distributions please let us know.

https://github.com/ccil-kbw/robot/releases

Download the tool and put it in /usr/sbin/iqamabot

To have the service running in the background you can follow these steps:

docs.title: Service File
docs.text:
Copy this and put it in /etc/systemd/system/iqamabot.service:

[Unit]
Description=iqamabot

[Service]
EnvironmentFile=/etc/iqama.d/conf.env
ExecStart=/usr/sbin/iqamabot -guild $GUILD_ID -token $BOT_TOKEN

[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target

docs.title: Environment
docs.text:
Create the environment configuration and put the information about your Discord Bot in it /etc/iqama.d/conf.env:

GUILD_ID=YOUR_GUILD_ID
BOT_TOKEN=YOUR_BOT_TOKEN

docs.title: Start and Enable
docs.text:
Start and Enable the Service:

sudo systemctl start iqamabot
sudo systemctl enable iqamabot

docs.title: Masjid's Droid - Introduction
docs.text:
The Masjid's Droid is the Application used at Khaled Ben Walid to serve the needs of the Administration. All features are Open to be used by anyone, the code source is available on our GitHub pages and contributions are welcome. See the Contributions page.

Full Docs

docs.title: Features Overview
docs.text: The features listed here are currently in the Alpha phase, feel free to open bug reports or simply suggestions in the Issues tabs on GitHub.

docs.title: Iqama CLI
docs.text: The Iqama CLI is a tool that gives you the current day's Iqama times directly in your terminal

docs.title: Discord Bot
docs.text: Currently the Discord Bot gives the Iqama directly on your Discord server.

docs.title: Dars Recorder
docs.text: This app serves as an automated recorder that integrates with OBS

docs.title: Roadmap
docs.text: Currently we only support the Iqama Source used by the Administration of Khaled Ben Walid https://iqama.ccil-kbw.com but we should make this app agnostic of the User's choices.

docs.title: Iqama Sources
docs.text: Integrate multiple Iqama sources (Many Majids have their own CSV files for Iqama or use popular tools from the App Store etc, we should be flexible to integrate any Iqama source)

docs.title: Deployment
docs.text: Improve deployments on all Applications (Something as easy as: curl https://raw.github.com/robot/install.sh | bash, with auto-detect of operating system)

docs.title: Auto-Updater
docs.text: Integrate automatic updates (with user's approval while displaying diff of CHANGELOG)
